With more MAKE TRAVEL MATTER® Experiences and sustainable partners than ever, this tour ensures your travels have a positive impact. Meet a descendant of Robert the Bruce at his ancestral home; visit the Balmoral Estate, a royal favourite of King Charles; and explore the revival of tartan at Prickly Thistle, Scotland’s first B-Corp certified textile mill. Search for seals, whales and seabirds in the pristine waters off Dornoch Bay and the Isle of Mull, supporting conservation-focused local operators. Unwind in luxury at Cameron House on the edge of Loch Lomond, where you can glide across the loch on an elegant champagne cruise—all while embracing a new era of responsible, high-end travel. This evening, dine on fine Scottish cuisine at Wedgwood The Restaurant, an intimate dining gem on Edinburgh’s historic Royal Mile. Day 2 - Edinburgh Uncover the rich heritage of Scotland’s capital alongside your Local Expert, strolling the iconic Royal Mile to the historic St Giles’ Cathedral. Step inside Edinburgh Castle, majestically perched atop Castle Rock. Later, enjoy time at leisure to wander through Princes Street Gardens, admire the Scott Monument, or explore the masterpieces of the Scottish National Gallery. Day 3 - St Andrews and Perth Savour a morning of exclusivity at Broomhall House, where Lord Bruce welcomes you for coffee and shares his family’s remarkable legacy. Immerse yourself in the charm of St. Andrews, the birthplace of golf and home to one of the oldest universities in the English-speaking world—where Prince William and Kate Middleton’s story began. As the day unfolds, arrive at your tranquil hotel, where impressive scenery and the stirring sound of a piper’s welcome create a truly memorable arrival. Day 4 - Perth, Culloden and Dornoch Journey through the spectacular landscapes of Cairngorms National Park, where Scotland’s natural beauty unfolds at every turn. Explore the grounds of Balmoral Castle with a dedicated expert, discovering the vistas beloved by the Royal Family. Or, visit Crathie Kirk, the church closely tied to royal tradition, before walking the historic battlefield of Culloden, where Bonnie Prince Charlie’s fate was sealed. This evening, dine at the elegant Dornoch Station Hotel, taking in spectacular views of the Scottish coastline. Day 5 - Dornoch Sightseeing Personalise Your Day with a choice of experiences: refine your skills with a golf lesson or explore the grandeur of Dunrobin Castle, a Highland gem. Pause at Loch Fleet Nature Reserve for a scenic viewpoint before enjoying time at leisure—stroll along Dornoch’s beach, visit its historic cathedral, or unwind in the tranquil surroundings. Day 6 - Loch Ness and Oban Experience a MAKE TRAVEL MATTER® Experience at Prickly Thistle, where the revival of Highland tartan supports sustainable artisans and their craft. Journey along the legendary shores of Loch Ness before exploring the wondrous landscapes of Glencoe with a wildlife ranger, another MAKE TRAVEL MATTER® Experience. Conclude your day in Oban at the elegant Knipoch House Hotel, where sea-view rooms offer a serene retreat. Day 7 - The Isle of Mull Explore the untamed beauty of the Isle of Mull, where dramatic coastlines and rolling hills create a haven for wildlife. Journey through this beautiful island, home to white-tailed eagles, otters and whales. Personalise Your Day by sampling fine whisky at Tobermory Distillery or take part in a MAKE TRAVEL MATTER® Experience at the Whale and Dolphin Trust, supporting vital marine conservation efforts. Day 8 - Oban to Glasgow Enjoy an exceptional Michelin-starred lunch , where inventive flavours take centre stage in the heart of Scotland. Then, retreat to the shores of Loch Lomond for a luxurious two-night stay at Cameron House, a stunning spa resort offering relaxation against a backdrop of the beautiful Highlands. Day 9 - Loch Lomond Today enjoy an unforgettable experience on Loch Lomond. Indulge in a champagne cruise, gliding across the tranquil loch in style. Raise a glass to your incredible journey through Scotland over dinner, sharing wine and memories with newfound friends.
